title: U.S. Funding Markets Show Signs of Stability Despite Russia Sanctions
sub_head: Borrowing rates have ticked up, but there are few indications of cash-hoarding after steps are taken to isolate the Ukraine invader from global financial system
body:
U.S. funding markets have remained relatively calm in recent days, easing the most-immediate concerns that sanctions against Russia would disrupt the basic functioning of the global financial system.
A big question facing Wall Street is how connected non-Russian banks are to sanctioned Russian institutions, and even nonsanctioned Russian sources of funding that banks might now want to avoid.
